title: Why Platform Disruption Is So Much Bigger than Product Disruption
excerpt: New products change what we buy, but new platforms have much broader effects.

title: The Businesses That Platforms Are Actually Disrupting
excerpt: Probably not the ones you think.

title: Beyond Disruption
excerpt: Clayton Christensen claims that Uber is not disruptive, and he’s exactly right. In fact, disruption theory often doesn’t make sense when it comes to understanding how companies succeed …

title: Every Company Is Up For Disruption, So Keep Your Products Simple | TechCrunch
excerpt: Editor's note: Victor Belfor is the vice president of business development at Influitive. He recently started angel investing and mentoring at 500 startups.  As products mature, companies continue to compete in heated battles with their competitors by adding more features and more functionality. However, a lot of customers would prefer fewer features because extra features tend to make products clunky and difficult to use. Still, companies become feature-producing machines.

title: Dollar Shave Club and the Disruption of Everything
excerpt: Dollar Shave Club is a textbook example of how the new Internet economy will destroy value in incumbent industries.
